laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) for herpes simplex virus (HSV)
laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive from surface swabs of the skin lesions on his back and oral cavity.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: 1:128 on day 2 of life, 1:64 at 2 months old, and 1:32 at 4 months old.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Antinuclear antibody titer at 1:320 in homogeneous pattern; anti-double-stranded DNA antibody at 219.35 IU (<25 IU negative). Antiextractable nuclear antigen profile was negative.

A subepidermal blister with basal vacuolar degeneration and some extravasated red blood cells; no viral cytopathic changes noted. Both HSV1 and HSV2 immunohistochemical stains were negative. Direct immunofluorescence was negative for Immunoglobulin G, Immunoglobulin A, Immunoglobulin M, C3, and fibrin.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat skin biopsy at 4 months showed mild spongiosis in the epidermis, thinned dermis, and fragmentation of dermal elastic tissue on the Elastic Verhoeff Van Gieson stain, consistent with scarring.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Cerebrospinal fluid, blood, and conjunctiva for HSV PCR
Blood count and liver function test
Investigations to exclude antiphospholipid syndrome (including anticardiolipin antibodies, lupus anticoagulant, anti-Î²2 glycoprotein 1 antibodies)
Ultrasound Doppler of kidneys and renal vessels
